intro: Villadia nelsonii, commonly known as the Nelson's villadia, is a rare flowering plant native to the southern regions of Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of red and yellow. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that form a basal rosette. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Villadia nelsonii is considered a conservation concern in its native range.
